cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi

instructions:
A full text keywords translater 
that translate user input to a engine recongized full text query
Search.feature:
Feature: search

Scenario: return all lines contains the user input words
Given the text content:
    |One little, two little, three little Indians|
    |Four little, five little, six little Indians|
    |Seven little, eight little, nine little Indians|
    |Ten little Indian boys.|
When I input <five>
Then the result will be: "Four little, five little, six little Indians"
